attributes.action: Ban the terrier men's terriers from trail hunts.
attributes.background: Since the Fox Hunting Ban in 2004, the terrier men are now simply there to lay the trail. The terriers are no longer necessary. Terriers were only used to flush out foxes before the ban.
attributes.additional_details:
The artificial scents that hunts lay should not lead into a badger sett or into a hole in the ground.
In traditional foxhunting the terriermen were used to stop/block fox earths and badger setts in the area where the hunting was to take place to prevent foxes from going to ground. The foxes would be located using terriers, dug out and fox bolted to be hunted again by the hounds. It's hard to imagine which roles terriers could now play in trail hunting and shouldn't be found with trail hunts.

attributes.action: Review the effectiveness of the outdated Child Destruction legislation
attributes.background: In June 2015 I was a victim of a violent assault during my 8th month of pregnancy. One of the two males who attacked me was the guy who got me pregnant. Unfortunately, this resulted in me giving birth to a stillborn baby boy Joel.
attributes.additional_details:
The Child Destruction legislation was introduced in 1929 as part of the Infant Life Act, to tackle late-term backstreet abortions. In modern times - though rarely used - the legislation has been used to convict perpetrators who have used violence with the intent to harm pregnant women whose babies are capable of living outside the mother's womb.

Due to the complexities of the law, there have been a number of inconsistencies when it comes to prosecuting and sentencing perpetrators.
#amendCDlaw

attributes.action: Change the law on Cross Border Hire of taxis and private hire vehicles.
attributes.background: Nationally in the UK thousands of drivers are exploiting the sub-contracting clause in the Deregulation Act 2015(section 55).This has allowed the situation whereby a person licensed in one authority can work as a PHV in any other authority in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
A good example of this exploitation would be; if a person took, and failed, a Knowledge test in one of the 316 Licensing authorities in the UK. This person could then choose to take a Knowledge Test in an authority with far fewer roads to learn, pass the test with ease, and then go back to work in the area they had originally failed in. 
The rise in drivers working for "app based" companies has seen the situation where drivers licensed in London are working in different authorities nationwide.

attributes.action: Provide women's health physio to all post natal woman for pelvic health advice.
attributes.background: I gave birth at the end of last year to my second child and was shocked by a letter from my GP saying unless I had "persistent bleeding/pain or wanted contraception" a routine 6 weeks check up was not required. This left me with no checks post major abdominal surgery which is very worrying.
attributes.additional_details: Women's health physios are perfect professionals for assessing, and treating the mother post natally. They can check many concerns like scar tissue healing, gynae health and abdominal separation issues. Sadly mothers are being left without anyone to talk to about incontinence, prolapse,diastasis recti problems and all of these can be prevented or at least symptoms managed to avoid surgery further down the line. Providing care at this stage will save the NHS money in the long run.

attributes.action: Protect UK Citizens' existing Freedom of Movement rights in Brexit negotiations
attributes.background: The UK Passport gives us, as EU Citizens, the Right to live and work in 28 EU Countries (& 3 EEA Countries). As UK Citizens, we do not want to lose this Right and ask that our Rights are fully protected and that they are valued and considered in any Brexit negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The Big EU Passport campaign was started in order to highlight the fact that the Freedom of Movement Rights of UK Citizens, who are currently EU Citizens, are not being prioritised in Brexit negotiations yet we currently have the Right to live and work in 31 countries.
 
Many people use this right in order to work in mainland EU yet live in the UK. Others want to maintain family connections.

For information about our campaign: http://breakingbrexit.blogspot.co.uk/2017/06/big-eu-passport.html

attributes.action: Demand For Tougher Action Against Moped Crime
attributes.background: Members of the public are becoming increasingly concerned and frustrated as to how moped crime is being dealt with. We want the government to take action. Moped crime (theft and acts of violence carried out on stolen mopeds) is increasing at an alarming rate. The government must act now
attributes.additional_details:
We the public want the authorities to issue police with greater power and resources in tackling this crimewave. 
Allow the police to pursue these thugs without fear of causing harm or injury to the criminals 
Implement a task force and better resources in dealing with the escalating moped crime
Afford police the time and resources to process evidence handed in by members of the public that would assist in any investigation
To provide secure fixing points for motorcycles and mopeds in the city

attributes.action: To consider the removal of parental responsibility for absent parents.
attributes.background: As a single parent, I believe I should behold the right to make decisions based on the benefit of my child solely as her primary and only care giver.
attributes.additional_details: For example, if an absent father makes the choice to pay no attention their child, I don’t think it's acceptable for any single parent to have to resort to permission from said father regarding decisions the mother wishes to make such as health, schooling and country of residency, if it will work in the best interests of the child.

attributes.action: Make companies legally obliged to pay mandatory breaks for professional drivers
attributes.background:
LGV and PCV Drivers are legally obliged to take unpaid breaks at very specific times, and can be fined, prosecuted or contracts terminated if they fail to do so.
Despite being unpaid, the drivers responsibility for the vehicle and load still remain, just so long as they are officially “not working”
attributes.additional_details:
It’s considered that a break is time off of work but for a professional Driver this is not the case. When stopping for a break the best scenario they can hope for is to be at a services. Not ideal but when considered that drivers also have to stop in lay-bys at small roads, it neither desirable or relaxing
In a 10 hour day, a Driver will typically be deducted 45mins pay because of his mandatory breaks, when they have barely left the place of work for even a few minutes

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single use plastic straws and cutlery in England
attributes.background:
The UK uses an estimated 8.5 million straw each years, which are amongst the top 10 items found in beach clean ups.

Plastic is damaging our ecosystem, not only killing animals, but also micro-plastics have been found in all water sources across the world - thought to be damaging to our health.
attributes.additional_details: Banning single use straws and cutlery across the UK would enable us to make a move towards environmental improvement.

attributes.action: To allow psv Licence holders to upgrade free to a class 2 lorry licence.
attributes.background: As a psv driver, you are driving vehicles that are longer than a class 2 lorry. And busses can weigh a lot more than a lorry as well. With a bus you are carrying precious cargo (passengers) so why can you not allow a psv licence holder to be allowed an automatic right to a class 2 licence.
attributes.additional_details: There is a huge shortage of hgv drivers within the UK. So surely by allowing a psv licence holder the right to a class 2 lorry licence, without the need of a further driving exam would make a lot of sense.

attributes.action: Make Autistic Spectrum Disorder widely known about within the DWP Assessments.
attributes.background: Regardless of where on the Autistic Spectrum an individual is, low or high functioning, they are similar but all have different needs. The biggest problem all ASD sufferers have in common is social and communication skills.
attributes.additional_details: It's a condition that one is born with and it will never not be there. There isn't medication to lessen the symptoms of Autism or to control them. There is a lack of education with the very people we put our trust in. The DWP response to a Freedom of Information (FOI) request stated 80% of Mandatory reconsiderations are rejected as performance indicators. That's almost 9 out of 10 people! There is much needed information being missed out in assessments where invisible illnesses are concerned.

attributes.action: Reduction is Television Licence for Deaf people due to accessibility issues.
attributes.background: Blind Registered Persons  , Including those who can see something, are entitled to 50% or 100%off Television Licence, Deaf persons should be entitled to a minimum of 25%off, Reason is that we cannot fully access all channel due to no Subtitling and/or Sign Language. So there is no Full Accessibility

attributes.action: UK Government to implement the Bercow: Ten Years On recommendations
attributes.background: I CAN and the Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists have just published a review of provision in England for children and young people with speech, language and communication needs. We are calling on the Government to implement its recommendations and MPs to support the review's findings.
attributes.additional_details: Visit www.bercow10yearson.com to download the report and recommendations in full.

attributes.action: That Parliament should not agree to the UK being part of an EU defence force.
attributes.background: President of the Commission said that the EU is moving to having a single defence force.   To avoid  UK forces being committed to such a military force under EU law, Brexit agreement should contain clear legal drafting that  excludes any such possibility.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-31796337 contains a report on the Presidents' policy by the BBC.   The joint statement between the President and the Prime Minister of 16th October mentions  security co-operation between the UK and the EU in the context of what happens after Brexit.

attributes.action: Don't merge the Parachute Regiment units with the Royal Marines Units.
attributes.background:
We are launching a petition against the proposals to merge the Parachute Regiment units and Royal Marines units.

We must put a stop to the government destroying our Armed Forces.

We do not want the government to merge these units and we do not want any more cuts to be made on our Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Prevent developers & land speculators from “gaming the system” in UK housing.
attributes.background:
Change the five year land supply to develop the right number of houses in the right places in accordance with a sustainable, relevant and up-to-date Local Plan.
Introduce a local measure of pipeline & delivery of homes to ensure that non-performing developers or land speculators can be identified.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting the right homes in the right places:
Where an LPA can openly show a supply of undelivered housing or land that exceeds a six year horizon to cover local population growth, there shall be no rights of appeal on the basis of land supply.
Measuring the pipeline and delivery of homes:
Where new homes aren’t registered with the LPA at a rate in accordance with plans set out and agreed with that LPA, then DCLG shall have the right to declare the developers / land speculators as non-performing.

attributes.action: Publicly reinforce the UK Government's commitment to preserving Net Neutrality.
attributes.background: Given the recent worrying proposals by the US Federal Communications Commission, now more than ever our government must make an early commitment to maintaining a British equivalent to the EU's 'Regulation on Open Internet Access' as part of the Great Repeal Bill during the Brexit transition.

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 3 months.
attributes.background: The current government is dysfunctional. Current policies ranging from NHS and social care to Brexit are causing great dismay. This country deserves better. The current government refuses to contribute to parliamentary votes, uses filibustering tactics and lacks transparency. This is not democracy.

attributes.action: Increase compulsory school age to 7
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest compulsory school ages in the world, and yet is behind other countries academically. Starting school at age 4 has a negative impact on children's education often leading to children being labelled with having additional needs when in reality they are simply not ready.

attributes.action: Automatic Settlement Rights to the Elderly Parents of the British Citizens
attributes.background: Elderly parents/relatives should be given an automatic right to settle in the UK subject to their UK family’s ability to maintain and accommodate them without recourse to the public funds.
attributes.additional_details: In the past few years, the immigration rules have made it virtually impossible for the elderly dependent parents/relatives of the British citizen to settle in the UK. This has led to the elderly parents forced to leave the UK and/or refusal of their entry clearance application resulting them living alone without the vital physical and emotional support. A change in the law is well overdue to make sure that they live with the dignity that they deserve in the most vulnerable years of their lives with their loved ones.

attributes.action: To impose an immediate two-way arms embargo between the UK and Israel
attributes.background:
Trading arms with Israel makes the UK complicit in Israel’s continuing violations of human rights and international law.

On the 30th March 2018, Israel killed 15 and injured 1,500 Palestinians, who protested the occupation and siege on Gaza.
attributes.additional_details:
The Israeli assault on Gaza in July-August 2014, in which 2,205 Palestinians (including 521 children) were killed, was only one example of Israel’s acts of violence against the Palestinian people. Yet UK-made weapons and military technologies continue to be sold to and used by the occupying Israeli forces.

Israeli military and industry sources openly attribute the success of Israeli exports to the weapons and technologies being ‘combat proven.’

attributes.action: Extend the 'Recall of MPs Act 2015'
attributes.background:
The Recall of MPs Act 2015 needs to be extended so that those MPs who go against the will of their own constituents can be recalled.

How can it be a representative democracy if our MPs are allowed to go against the will of the people who elect them to represent them?
attributes.additional_details: Failing to represent those who elect them is as much a travesty as any of the current reasons given for calling for a Recall of any of our elected representatives but at this time the Recall of MPs Act 2015 does not cover such an eventuality and those signing this petition feel that it should.

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement that all hunting dogs on a hunt should be muzzled.
attributes.background:
Hounds are killing foxes on trail and drag hunts. Where they may follow a live fox scent or come across a fox.
They are also on occasions attacking pet dogs and other wildlife.
They can be very intimidating to general public also.
By having these hunting dogs muzzled would prevent any incidents.

attributes.action: Make Houses of Parliament alcohol free.
attributes.background: The issue of sexual harassment at work is a matter of concern, not least within Parliament. We believe Parliament should lead the way in ending this abuse. Many complaints are reported to arise in situations where alcohol is involved. Parliament is a place of work and there is no need for alcohol.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1293902/MPs-drunk-hour-drinking-session-voted-Budget.html The culture of drinking within the Houses of Parliament is a national disgrace. Ending the sale of alcohol, both at bars and with meals, would not only help reduce sexual harassment, but help members stay alert and able to conduct business on behalf of the tax payer. Parliament is a place of work, and there is no need for alcohol to be served.

attributes.action: Require local authorities to adopt all Public Open Space and roads on estates
attributes.background: Local authorities are avoiding increasing their grounds maintenance responsibilities on new private estates by requiring developers to form management companies to deal with the maintenance long term. These management fees are an extra tax on hard working families. Councils should adopt the land.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities used to be paid commuted sums by housing developers to adopt open land and roads. Local authorities would be responsible for the long term maintenance for these assets. In practice, management companies are established for some roads and public open spaces to be maintained long term. Management companies charge excessive amounts for in effect a second “council tax”. The government should force all local authorities to adopt all roads and public open space on private estates.

attributes.action: Protect vulnerable debtors in enforceable Taking Control of Goods ​Regulations
attributes.background: Taking Control of Goods National Standards contains guidance for Enforcement Agents when dealing with vulnerable debtors - this guidance is unclear and results in vulnerable people being exploited unnecessarily and new Regulations to clarify this should be debated by Parliament
attributes.additional_details: Give stronger support to vulnerable council tax debtors than provided in T​aking Control of Goods​, National Standards for Enforcement Agents​ paras 70-78 Vulnerable Situations. Local Authority should be advised not to send bailiffs to collect the tax from households which have no income due to zero hours contract, benefit sanction or Universal Credit. Bailiffs should be required to report those circumstances​ in households they call on ​to the local authority with out taking any further action.

attributes.action: Stop the unfair electoral boundary changes!
attributes.background:
There's currently a plan to reduce the number of MP's by "revising" the electoral boundaries (MP constituency seats).
The changes are not fair. More power will go to the remaining MP's & this is scary. We will permanently lose 50 MP's which will mean our votes matter less. Stop the changes.
attributes.additional_details:
If we have 50 less MP's, those new MP's who take over a neighbouring constituency will have more emails and more letters which they will probably not respond to. We'll have less chances to speak to our MP's. It will also mean less representation in Parliament for the British Public.The population needs proper representation.

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/17/boundary-changes-house-of-commons-mps-ministers-plans
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerrymandering

attributes.action: Bring forward the order for the Red Arrows Hawk Jets with BAE Systems
attributes.background: Let’s get backing both the future of The Red Arrows and a great British company; BAE Systems.The Red Arrows; an iconic British treasure which means so much more than money and politics. We need to show the government how much we need to promote national pride in these uncertain times.
attributes.additional_details: The time to act is NOW, BAE Systems is in need of immediate short term stability and the current Red Arrows aircraft only have a limited number of years left before they will be de-commissioned.

attributes.action: Debate effect of pumping out brine at Fleetwood on marine life and livelihoods
attributes.background: Consent has been given for brine to be pumped out at Fleetwood.  Pumping will continue for years, whilst they build underground gas storage caverns. Local experts have concerns about the possible effects on our delicate marine ecology and on local livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details:
There are concerns relating to conservation; the food chain; fishing industry; tourism; polluted water from Fleetwood dock; and the accuracy of dispersal modelling.

We call for a parliamentary debate on the brine discharge and on whether the benefits of this project for the UK outweigh the possible negative impacts on the local area.

attributes.action: Give all Ancient Woodland statutory legal protection.
attributes.background: Ancient Woodland is a nationally important wildlife habitat in its own right, acting as a natural flood defence air filter and carbon store, while providing homes for species that depend on it for survival. Once it's gone it's gone, legal protection should be brought in line with SSSIs as a minimum.
attributes.additional_details: With 13% of the UK's landmass covered in woodland, compared to the EU average of around 35% we are significantly lagging behind our European counterparts. We must protect our ancient woodlands as part of a program of woodland expansion that will help us to reduce the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere and slow the progress of rainwater, reducing flooding downstream. Expanding will help reverse the decline of woodland species as highlighted by the UK State of Nature Report 2016.

attributes.action: Programme to fund aspiring commercial pilots training similar to university fees
attributes.background: Training fees for aspiring commercial pilots can be huge, with some of the most costly courses ranging up to £125,000. Currently there is no widely available method for people in the UK to help fund their training. We propose that the Government provide a funding scheme for future pilots.
attributes.additional_details:
The current lack of a pilot loan scheme means that pilots from the UK are at a competitive disadvantage compared to those from other countries, e.g some Scandinavian countries, where a scheme is provided.
BALPA, representing over 75% of UK pilots, recently voiced concerns on this matter, stating that pilot training should be more accessible (http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/airline-pilots-rich-cost-training-poor-students-industry-warn-british-airline-pilots-association-a7899886.html#r3z-addoor)
An important point is that some schemes incrementally repay a large percentage (up to 60%) of the fee back on completion of training.

attributes.action: Make diagnosis enough for children with SEN to get the help and provision needed
attributes.background: Throughout the UK there are thousands of children struggling in mainstream school. My son is one of many. He is Aspergers/ADHD. He needs a specialist provision and one on one support. He and all of the other children are made to fail the system before they qualify for help. Something needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
* Diagnosis should be enough for a specialist provision
* Support should be given immediately to children whose parents choose for them to stay in mainstream
* Children have to fail in mainstream before they can get assistance, the system is failing our children
* EHCP process takes too long
* Funding needs to be increased
* We need more specialist schools
* ALL children deserve the right to an education in a setting that suits their needs.
* SEN Children need SEN support

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that foreign nationals hold medical insurance before entry to UK
attributes.background: The NHS is free at point of contact for all. Foreign Nationals often use the NHS then leave the country without paying for treatment. I therfore petition parliament to enshrine in law that ALL Foreigners should hold medical insurance and must prove that they hold this before entering the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The UK needs to look after the NHS and nurture it. We have the finest health care system in the world. But it can no longer cope with the influx and lack of funding. Making sure that foreign nationals have health insurance before they enter the UK will help elevate some of the funding issues the NHS currently has. It will also eliminate health tourism and free up appointments that are much needed for UK Nationals.

attributes.action: Make General Dental Council (GDC) a tax-payer funded organisation.
attributes.background:
The General Dental Councils remit is to work for patients whilst working with dentists.
It is now time for the funding of this body to be reviewed and for it to be paid for out of general taxation.

attributes.action: NHS doctors and dentists should receive a payrise of at least 3% in 2018.
attributes.background: All NHS staff get a payrise of at least 6.5% (and up to 29%) over the next 3 years except doctors and dentists. Since 2008, doctors have experienced the largest drop in earnings of all professions, with consultants seeing a 19 per cent fall in pay, junior doctors 21 per cent and GPs 20 per cent.
attributes.additional_details:
The BMA said that doctors' pay should be increased in line with the wider economy, and it has called for the pay of all UK doctors to be increased in line with the RPI (Retail Price Index), plus £800 or 2 per cent, whichever is greater. (https://www.bma.org.uk/news/2018/february/bma-seeks-pay-rise-for-doctors-in-line-with-wider-economy).
In 2017-2018, the UK inflation rate has been about 3%. (https://tradingeconomics.com/united-kingdom/inflation-cpi)

attributes.action: Call for a British Government apology for the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre of 1919
attributes.background: In 1919 Colonel Dyer ordered his men to fire, and maybe 1,000 peaceful protesters were left dead. At the time Winston Churchill proclaimed the massacre "monstrous" and the British Government condemned Dyer for his actions, but no apology has since been forthcoming. It is now time to apologise.

attributes.action: Make it legal requirement to publish carbohydrate values of food in restaurants
attributes.background:
Over 4 million people in the UK have Diabetes.
In order to give the correct dose of Insulin with a meal, it's imperative to have accurate carbohydrate values available.
Without this, a diabetic is forced to guess and could either under/over medicate which can cause life threatening complications!

attributes.action: I would like all military veterans to receive free train travel in the UK
attributes.background:
To support current military veterans and homeless veterans with free travel on trains within the UK to support with social, mental welfare and support.
Reducing stress, anxiety and the chance to mix with likeminded persons who may also be suffering with issues from leaving the services.
attributes.additional_details: Currently veterans will meet annually to mix with old comrades and to get the feeling of support that we don’t feel we get from our normal lives. The people missing from these events are the homeless Vets and PTSD suffers who struggle on a daily basis. I see this as an area that other Vets can support struggling veterans with one to one meetings or planned events. This could reduce suicides and reduce strains on the NHS. The number of travel could be set minimum of 3 per year.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if the Government  avoids an Opposition Day vote again.
attributes.background:
Government abstained from the Opposition Day vote on Universal Credit (18/10/17), insulting both democracy & Parliament.

In the words of John Bercow: “This institution is bigger than any one party & is bigger than any government”

If the Government doesn’t respect this then we must replace it.

attributes.action: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients or use in production
attributes.background: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients e.g. animal fat in fabric softener and isinglass (swim bladder of fish) in wine production.  A simple label that there IS or IS NOT any animal ingredient or derivative used at any stage of manufacture without constantly searching the internet.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like it made mandatory that all products ie, tyre, decorating materials, household cleaners, garden products, clothes and footwear, to be clearly marked that they contain animal derivatives such as gelatin, animal based glues, and shellac.  In other words, everything that is sold in the UK. The Co-op already state on the front of their cleaning products etc. whether there is no animal ingredients.
Many items marked cruelty free still contain animal ingredients which causes confusion.

attributes.action: Debate: The EU referendum is now invalid due to demographic changes over time.
attributes.background: 1.2m people made up the leave majority. 600,000 uk people die each year, the same join the electorate. 2/3 of older voters are leavers. 2/3 of younger voters are remainders. The referendum is valid for a short time only before it ceases to represent the will of the people.

attributes.action: Move the last Bank Holiday in May, into June
attributes.background: Two bank holidays in May create a problem for employers.

attributes.action: Rule that freeholders must cover safety related costs of their buildings
attributes.background: On June 14 2017, 71 people saw there lives cut short after the Grenfell Tower was destroyed by fire, and all survivors have seen their lives hopelessly changed. The same type of cladding, which played a key role in the tragedy by allowing the fire to spread, has been found on more than 250 blocks.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaseholders of many private blocks are being charged for all implemented measures, even though Sajid Javid, DCLG Secretary urged owners/management companies not to do so. Replacement works worth £millions won't start until funds are in place, endangering lives. 

Let’s join together to ask Government to rule formally that freeholders are responsible for costs of ensuring the safety of our buildings and provide economic support to guarantee prompt implementation of whatever measures needed.

attributes.action: To abolish ground rent payments on existing residential property leases
attributes.background:
1)Ground rent is a form of exploitation, particularly when it is set to double over the life of a lease every 10,15,20 or 25 years

2)The government supports setting ground rent to zero on new leases: a disparity of treatment between old and new leases would put existing leases at disadvantage
attributes.additional_details:
No service is essentially provided in return for ground rent payments

Freeholders already receive an income when lease is extended 

Setting ground rent to zero would likely reduce rent charged to tenants by leaseholder landlords

As an alternative the government should set the maximum ground rent to £200 per year over the life of the lease

Leasehold properties with increasing ground rents are more difficult to sell as lenders are reluctant to approve mortgages to buy these properties

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that on 29 March 2019 at 23:00 the NHS gets an extra 350million.
attributes.background: The British people voted on the 23rd June 2016 to give the NHS an extra £350million per week. This is the will of the British people and we will not tolerate any attempt to block this via the back door. Many of the people making this promise are in government today, and must be held to account.
attributes.additional_details:
Current members of the cabinet made this promise very clearly and in exit polls this was given as one of the main reasons for voting to leave the EU.

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tony-blair-theresa-may-win-general-election-jeremy-corbyn-labour-leader-uk-prime-minister-a7705026.html

attributes.action: Help get SDR (selective dorsal Rhizotomy) operation on the NHS
attributes.background: Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy (SDR) is a neurosurgical procedure aimed at reducing spasticity (tight and stiff muscle tone) in the lower limbs. It's most commonly used for children with spastic diplegia (two limbs affected) which accounts for 25 to 30% of children born with cerebral palsy.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK, the National Institute of Clinical Excellence (NICE) has issued guidance demonstrating that SDR is most effective for children between 3 and 10 years of age.

attributes.action: Make St Georges Day a Bank Holiday in England.
attributes.background:
A nation’s patron Saint should be celebrated. 

England is one of a very select few who do not hold the privilege of being granted their National Patron Saints day off work as a Bank Holiday.

attributes.action: Kids with allergies must have a right to eat safe food from home at eateries.
attributes.background: We were recently humiliated and almost refused service when we brought home made food for our son, who has life threatening allergies, to a play centre. We believe that this is a form of discrimination. Parents should have the right to provide safe food for their children without being shamed.
attributes.additional_details: Since my experience, I have discovered many other similar stories where parents are publicly shamed. We are an invisible group who are discriminated against but have no protection under the law. We would like to enjoy going out as a family knowing that our children are safe.

attributes.action: Use Foreign Aid budget for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget currently stands at £13bn. This is far too high. We believe charity begins at home and that the Foreign Aid budget should be used for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly who have been the backbone of our country.

attributes.action: UK denounce South African motion to seize white owned land without compensation.
attributes.background: On the 27th of February the South African National Assembly passed a motion brought by the EFF leader MP Mr Julius Malema to have their Constitution amended to intensify land redistribution though the introduction of “expropriation of land without compensation”. This move targets only white farmers.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.parliament.gov.za/news/national-assembly-debates-motion-land-expropriation  The link refers to Settlers taking land in 1660. The problem of correcting this now without compensation is unfair. Families have owned and bought this land for generations. The current occupants are not guilty of stealing land. If South Africa goes ahead with this it is not only a violation of occupants human rights but will severely damage the South African economy. Britain should speak out against this.
